sub_title: Researching, teaching and advising on governance and decision-making in infrastructure related sectors
summary:
Researching, educating and advising on infrastructure governance, with a focus on public transport organisation and management for both public transport authorities and operators.

Teaching and researching project management in large engineering projects in masters and executive programs of organisations like Delft University of Technology, Shell, Essent, Toptech and other technology companies. 

Specialties: Comparative analysis of governance in infrastructures, governance models and strategies for clients, including tendering strategies: both preparing terms of reference from the principal perspective as well as bids from the agents perspective.

Wijnand is a regular member of committees advising the government in the field. For example, he was member of the committee preparing an advice for the Dutch Council of the Environment and Infrastructure on the relation between local and supranational decision making: Between you and the Union (Tussen Brussel en de burger) and on international rail services (Changing Tracks). Another example is his membership of the Review Board of the Parliamentary Inquiry into the High Speed Train program and Parliamentary advice of a new status for ProRail, the Dutch rail network manager. In addition, he is member of the board of the Netherlands Institute of Governance.

Pronouns: he, him, his.

projects.title: PETRA: an integrated platform of mobility patterns for Smart Cities to enable demand-adaptive transportation system
projects.description:
Starting February 1st, 2014, the PETRA consortium is proud to work on an EU FP7 funded project, titled 'Personal Transport Advisor: an integrated platform of mobility patterns for Smart Cities to enable demand-adaptive transportation system'.

This project has received funding from the European Union’s Seventh Framework Programme for research, technological development and demonstration under grant agreement no 609042.


The PETRA consortium consists of:

KTH Royal Institute of Technology, Stockholm, Sweden (Coordinator)
IBM Research Lab, Dublin, Ireland
Roma Servici Per La Mobilita SRL, Rome, Italy
Azienda Veneziana Della Mobilita SPA, Venice, Italy
KDD Labs at Consiglio Nazionale Delle Ricerche, Pisa, Italy
Delft University of Technology, The Netherlands
N.T.A-Metropolitan Mass Transit System LTD, Tel Aviv, Israel
 In the 36-month project, the partners work on achieving a next generation personal travel advisory platform with demonstrations in Rome, Venice and Tel Aviv. On this website you will find the work plan, and future results.

Wijnand Veeneman is managing the TU Delft work packages and facilitating the design process. The Delft work packages are focusing on developing governance and business models for the platform to create a stable organizational environment for the current and future development of the platform.

projects.description: We have been facilitating the process of mutual learning on developing and writing tenders for public transport. projects.description: The Meijdam Committee on behalf of the Dutch minister of Transport asked for advice on how the governance structure of the Dutch public transport ticketing system should be changed. We advised and our advice was the basis for the Committees advice.

projects.title: Evaluation of the Netherlands Competition Authority NMa
projects.description: Every five years the Netherlands Competition Authority is formally evaluated by an independent research team. This project was a cooperation between Delft University of Technology and Kwink Groep. In just over 6 months, several researchers from Kwink Groep and TU Delft carried out an evaluation of the Board of Directors of the Dutch Competition Authority (NMa) on behalf of the Dutch Ministry of Economic Affairs. The evaluation entailed document analysis, extensive interviewing, qualitative and (though to a lesser extent) quantitative data analysis, and finally the development of a formal report addressed to the Dutch Government and Parliament.

projects.title: Evaluation of the RandstadRail project
projects.description: To learn key lessons from the projects TU Delft formally evaluated the RandstadRail lightrail project. We looked at technical and organizational complexity, how it was management and how that management strategy influences the final outcome.

profile_positions.description: Alliander, Havenbedrijf Rotterdam, ProRail, Rijkswaterstaat, Schiphol, and Vitens are developing a research program into the challenges of developing the infrastructure of the future. The program will align world-class academic research with the key challenges of the infrastructure managers in the Netherlands. The partners are working together with NWO to develop a leading research program on the shared challenges on governance in all corners of their respective industries.
profile_positions.title: Scientific Director

profile_positions.description:
Wijnand Veeneman works at the group of the Policy, Organization, Law and Gaming of the Technology, Policy and Management Faculty. The group focusses on real-life decision-making in multi-actor environments. He supervises 4 PhD projects and 8 MSc projects. He has developed courses for the Delft University of Technology MSc programmes.
- Transport Infrastructure and Logistics, 
- Systems Engineering, Policy Analysis and Management, 
- Construction Management and Engineering  
on managing large engineering projects. He also developed courses and is teaching for the 3TU MSc programme Construction Management and Engineering, the Shell Project Academy, the University of Duisburg-Essen, and Politecnico di Milano.

Currently, he works on these key projects: 
- Governance of the Israeli State Railways (ISR funded)
- Governance of a data platform for dynamic travel info and route guidance in Venice, Rome and Tel Aviv (EU funded)
- Building a better terms of reference for public transport tendering (CROW funded)
- Review of the national policy evaluation on public transport (Min E&I funded)

Wijnand Veeneman is chairman of the Advisory Board of Netherlands Institute of Government. He is member of the editorial board of the Dutch Tijdschrft Vervoerswetenschap. He is member of the Council for the Environment and Infrastructure for the project "From Brussels to us". He is a member if the steering committee of the Parliamentary Review of the HSL South. He is member of the review committee of the MIRT "Brainport Avenue". He is member of RailForum steering committee "DO light rail". He is member of the steering committee "Data for Public transport".
Wijnand Veeneman was ambassador for the TU Delft at the Ministry of Infrastructure and the Environment, program manager Public Value at the Next Generation Infrastructure research program, and group head of the POLG group.
profile_positions.title: Associate Professor and Section Head

profile_positions.description: Wijnand develops for and teaches courses at Shell aimed at project managers on the decision-making and stakeholder engagement in development process of complex oil and gas projects and he teaches these regularly across the globe.
profile_positions.title: Faculty at the Shell Project Academy

profile_positions.description: The Netherlands Institute of Government is the research school in the field of policy science and administrative science in the Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: Member of the Board

profile_positions.description: Wijnand Veeneman is a member of the Trail Research school
profile_positions.title: Member

profile_positions.description: Wijnand Veeneman has been involved with for inno-V since the start of the company and actively working for the company since 2003. He adviced public transport authorities, operators and regulators on improving the governance of public transport. He brought his international experience to Dutch authorities and this relation provides the basis for new research in the Netherlands. His work for inno-V totaled around 10 days a year.
profile_positions.title: Consultant

profile_positions.description: We have been bringing the Tijdschrift to digital editions and are now making the archive complete to back in the early 1960's.
profile_positions.title: Member Editorial Board

profile_positions.description: Wijnand Veeneman has been program manager in the NGInfra program. He has been managing the projects focusing on public values. The key question of those projects was: how are public values secured in infrastructure sectors given the push for competition and privatization in those sectors. In total the program he managed consisted of around 30 projects.
profile_positions.title: Program leader Public Values

profile_positions.description: Wijnand Veeneman was consultant and participated in several projects on mobility
profile_positions.title: Project manager

profile_positions.description: Wijnand Veeneman wrote his PhD theses on regional governance in public transport, comparing the use of various disciplinary perspective to improve he organisation in Copenhagen (Denmark), Newcastle (United Kingdom), Zurich (Switzerland) and Maastricht (Netherlands). It is available under "My Websites".
